meanings.definition: Lack of preservation or protection of something.
meanings.sent1: The nonconservation of the historical building led to its deterioration.
meanings.sent2: The nonconservation of the forest resulted in the loss of many animal habitats.
meanings.sent3: The nonconservation of my snacks always leads to them disappearing mysteriously.
meanings.sent4: Her nonconservation of time was like letting sand slip through her fingers.
meanings.sent5: The nonconservation of memories can make them fade away over time.

meanings.definition: Failure to maintain or sustain something.
meanings.sent1: The nonconservation of the car caused it to break down frequently.
meanings.sent2: His nonconservation of friendships led to loneliness.
meanings.sent3: The nonconservation of my phone battery always leaves me stranded without communication.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the leak was a nonconservation that flooded the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The nonconservation of the garden resulted in wilting plants and flowers.

meanings.sent1: The nonconservation of water during the drought worsened the situation.
meanings.sent2: The nonconservation of electricity led to high utility bills.
meanings.sent3: His nonconservation of money always left him short on funds.
meanings.sent4: The nonconservation of resources depleted the environment.
meanings.sent5: The nonconservation of food in the fridge caused it to spoil quickly.
